title: The sticky problem of plastic wrap - National Geographic
body: A plastic pollution treaty, called Paris Plus, would come with a mandate—and more muscle than the climate accord. California's sweeping new plastics law could be a game changer.
readable_content:
user (2023-12-08): SKIP TO CONTENT
- Plastic wrap, discovered by accident, has become a popular item in American households, with more than 100 brands to choose from.
- Plastic wrap use contributes to the plastic pollution crisis, poses recycling challenges, and is made from potentially harmful chemicals.
- The chemical composition of plastic wraps varies, leading to concerns about toxic additives and their impact on human health.
- Manufacturers defend plastic wrap, citing its role in reducing food waste, while environmental activists call for alternatives and improved recycling infrastructure.
- Reusable wax wraps and glass containers are suggested as alternatives to plastic wrap.

This summary provides information about the history, environmental impact, and health concerns related to plastic wrap.
